BioShock Infinite was a lot shorter than I thought it would be, but after finishing it i can firmly say that it is one of the best single player games i have ever played. The game looks and runs perfectly for a game that came out 8 years ago. the story and the characters are very well written. I sympathized with the characters which is a very hard thing to come by with a lot of games these days. overall the story was a 10/10 but sometimes during the story I had some trouble understanding what was going on but after completing the game most of the stuff that i was confused about clicked in place. overall if your looking for a short single player game with guns and a good story do not hesitate to pick this game up when it goes on sale.
Top

[b][u][h1]A Cynical Review: Bioshock - Infinite[/h1][/u][/b]

[b][u]Is There A Plot?:[/u][/b]
To say there is a plot is an understatement for this game. I have never played a shoot to date that has as good a story as Bioshock – Infinite. As a series known for its clincher plot twists, Infinite definitely takes the cake, almost guaranteeing a second playthrough out of it so you can fully understand the magnitude of its ending. An absolutely phenomenal story with incredibly written protagonists. 

The two story based DLC Episodes, Burial At Sea, are amazing & create a cyclical nature to the Bioshock series. Burial At Sea will end, & Bioshock 1 will begin.

[b][u]Is This Even Fun?:[/u][/b]
Bioshock – Infinite plays very similarly to the first two games while always feeling fresh & unique. It is like Bioshock 1 meets Doom 4. The combat pacing is very fast & the range of Weapons & Vigors you are given is pretty broad. There is so much going on in this game for a linear shooter. It is more linear than the first two games. Your customization in the Weapons you can carry & bonuses you can equip are more limited, but more focused if that makes sense. You do get a companion that follows you around, Elizabeth, & her AI is amazing. I think most companions in future games should be based off her; she is incredibly useful!

The Burial At Sea DLCs change up gameplay a bit harkening back to the original Bioshock which is pretty cool. The third DLC, Clash In the Clouds, is an Arena based DLC which is only fun due to the strength of the fast paced, chaotic, combat in this game.

[b][u]100% Achievements?:[/u][/b]
Unlocking 100% of the Achievements is tricky… but possible. 79/80 Achievements are doable, some being harder than others. But there is one Achievement in the Clash In the Clouds DLC that is an absolute nightmare. It essentially requires you to complete 60 mini-Achievements with challenges ranging from simple to obscene. Good luck with that! Check out my 100% Achievement Walkthrough, A Cynical Guide: Bioshock – Infinite for more details.

[b][u]Is It Worth Buying?:[/u][/b]
Even if you have never played Bioshock 1 or 2, this is a game every true gamer should play. It has one of the best stories I have ever witnessed in a shooter, or most games in general. You must play this game!

[b]10/10[/b]

Beautiful game that's world-building, story-telling, voice-acting, graphics, etc still hold up to this day. Played the entire thing in one night because it's like reading a really good book that you can't put down. It hooks you early and you get engulfed by this fun story, constantly trying to figure out where it's going.

esse jogo sem dúvida entrou para o meu Top 10° games da vida; o enredo é perfeito, e quando eu falo perfeito é PERFEITO mesmo, eles fizeram um história complexa sem deixar nenhum furo de roteiro, a jogabilidade é excelente e feita para ser jogado no mouse/teclado, você pode jogar no controle, claro, mas vai perder 70% do dinamismo dos combates (ainda mais se você, como eu, jogar no Hard), os gráficos então...uau, são os melhores da 7° geração, ultrapassa The Last of Us, Halo 4, GTA V e por ai vai...sobre a dificuldade do game; se você entender como a Elizabeth e os vigores funcionam você domina ela, vai passar no hard tranquilamente, só uma parte ou outra que vai ser difícil, lá perto do final, enfim, compre, você não vai se arrepender. OBS; eu comprei o Bioshock Collection por R$23~, é basicamente cinco jogos (contando os originais + remasters) completos, com DLC e tudo

Le jeu a une très bonne durée de vie et son histoire est excellente; cependant, si vous avez du mal avec les voyages dans le temps et les mondes parallèle, sachez que ce jeu utilise ces deux mécaniques en même temps ce qui peut rendre la compréhension globale complexe.
Bien que le jeu soit une gigantesque quête d'escorte, à aucun moment on n'est gêné par la présence d'Elizabeth. Au contraire, elle vous spotte les ennemis spéciaux, vous envoie périodiquement soins et munitions, bref, vous avez la sensation d'avoir une équipière et pas de traîner un boulet.

Il n'y a malheureusement toujours pas de NG+ pour profiter de nos améliorations, d'autant plus que le jeu dispose de tellement d'armes et toniques par rapport à l'argent disponible qu'il est impossible de tout améliorer dans une partie.

En point noir, je noterai tout de même le fait qu'on ne peut plus transporter toutes les armes, notre capacité étant limitée à deux armes en même temps, ce qui peut s'avérer compliquer dans certaines grosses bastons.

Une fois le jeu fini, vous débloquez la difficulté ultime que je déconseille aux joueurs sanguins comme moi, car certaines phases sont à s'arracher les cheveux; même avec la vie et le bouclier au max, vous mourrez en 3 ou 4 tirs.

Je recommande également de faire les deux DLC "Tombeau sous-marin" qui en plus de jouer la carte de la nostalgie de Rapture, apporte des informations supplémentaires à la compréhension du lore de Bioshock Infinite et permet de finaliser le lien entre Infinite et les deux premiers jeux.
L'épisode 1 est semblable au jeu principal, bien que la difficulté soit un peu rehaussée.
L'épisode 2, dans lequel on incarne Elizabeth, est orienté infiltration et furtivité.

Especially considering the whole collection is dirt cheap it will be probably one of the best deals you ever made.

[h1] BioShock Infinite [/h1]

Ambientado no estilo steampunk o game nos proporciona um drama cujo protagonista que após perder a sua esposa recebe uma proposta para viajar até Columbia e resgatar uma garota e leva-la ate Nova York afim de quitar suas dívidas.

[h1] Gameplay [/h1]
 Fluida e bem desenvolvida as mecânicas do BioShock Infinite não deixam nada a desejar, com uma ampla variedade de armas e poderes, a jornada tem vários puzzles criativos e BossBattles muito distintas que rendem boas hora de jogo.

[h1] Trilha Sonora [/h1]
Certamente uma trilha sonora é muito rica e intensa, expressa muito bem os sentimentos de cada cena.

[h1] Gráficos [/h1]
Por serem de gerações passadas (PS3 e Xbox360) os gráficos ainda são de encher os olhos e deixa muitos jogos atuais no chinelo quando comparamos o nível de detalhes e “carinho” em desenvolver ambientes que agreguem a jornada.

[h1] História [/h1]
O ponto forte desse jogo, simplesmente uma das melhores narrativas do mundo dos games, mesmo não sendo uma continuação direta dos primeiros dois jogos, eles se conectam de uma maneira muito suave, sem forçar a barra.
Os personagens tem carisma e personalidade, é divertido compreender o desenrolar da trama pois a cada momento vemos algo novo complementando tanto o passado quanto o presente, sem contar as reviravoltas (Plot) que foram muito bem encaixadas e “abrem nossa mente”.

Как видите, я провела в игре больше 100 часов, и я не жалею ни об одной минуте проведенной в очередном шедевре под названием BioShock. Вся трилогия для меня нечто особенное, особенно BioShock Infinite, можно сказать что это первая игра которую я никогда не пиратила даже не смотря на то что у меня отсутствовали DLC полностью очень долгое время, а я скачиваю почти каждую игру прежде чем купить ее в Steam. Сам сюжет захватывает с первых минут, Лютесы для меня просто краши которых я по сей день обожаю, Букер ДеВитт именно тот кто подходит на роль последней части трилогии, она рушит шаблоны, первые две части действительно были хороши, они показывали мир антиутопии очень красочно что-ли (хоть игра в очень темных тонах), но Infinite наоборот очень красочна и сочная хоть и поднимает тему немного отошедшую от тех что были ранее. Первые две части показывали молчаливость героев, в то время как Букер очень любит и поговорить с Комстоком, и посетовать на то что его чуть не утопил идиотский священник. Все эти различия просто великолепны, я скачивала это на достаточно старый комп, и она на средних параметрах летала (а компу 11 лет). Я искренне советую игру тем кто является фанатам первых двух игр

Okay, so lets talk about Burial at Sea 2. Its different than the base game, or the Episode 1. You play as a different character. You do less damage with weapons, and you are less proficient with them. Even though lethal weapons are harder to use, you get a non-lethal crossbow with different types of bolts. Stealth is the big aspect in this episode. Listen to this: there are different types of floors, and each type makes different amount of noise. There are regular floors, carpet floors, metal floors; there are also water puddles and broken glass that will give your position away; light and dark places play a big role too. I forgot to mention, there are vents in this game. I fucking love vents. Since we are at the topic of the vents, another thing this episode adds is verticality in the level design. A lot of encounters have a few different approaches. Really reminded me of Arkane Studios level design. Lets not forget the Batman Arkham series hooks and rooms designed around taking enemies down 1 by 1.    

I didn't really like the gameplay loop in the base game, since it lost the strategic touch that B1 and B2 had. Episode 1 was a pleasant surprise, because it was actually hard on 'hard' difficulty and you really had to manage the resources. Episode 2 just brought it to another level.   

Side note: 1998 difficulty mode is also really fun, you should try it.
